name: overweight

B2 fat: He used to be very overweight. I'm only a few pounds overweight, but I just can't seem to lose them. an overweight man/woman/child Opposite
underweight

having more flesh on the body than averagefatHe's got fatter as he's got older.overweightShe used to be overweight.obeseMore and more children are becoming obese.plumpHe's got rather plump since I last saw him.chubbyLook at the baby's chubby little legs.

FINANCE, STOCK MARKET used to describe portfolios (= combinations of investments) that include too much of a particular type of share, bond, etc.: The investment team will eliminate an overweight position when it believes a security is overvalued. See also
underweight
TRANSPORT heavier than is allowed: If your luggage is overweight, you have to pay extra.
